Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents, with date year 10[+x].
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 62
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393176) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393176)
